name: Lifetmm
tagline: Simulate the spontaneous emission rate of dipoles or the EM fields within a stacked material.
body:
### Overview.
This package contains several functions to simulate the electromagnetic field within an optically homogeneous and isotropic multilayered structure. At the moment the package functionality is contained within two classes:

* The TransferMatrix class calculates the electric or magnetic field within a multilayered structure (and optionally the cladding) for an incoming field at an angle with a given polarisation.
* The LifetimeTmm class builds on the TransferMatrix class to calculate the spontaneous emission rate (or radiative lifetime) of a dipole in a non-absorbing (multilayered) medium.

I have tried to make the classes easy to use with a bit of error checking so that knowledge of the inner code workings is not required. Please see the examples to get an idea of what can be simulated.

### Literature and Code References
#### TransferMatrix
The procedure is adapted from the two references

> J. Appl. Phys Vol 86, No. 1 (1999) p.487
> JAP 93 No. 7 p. 3693 

The code is **heavily** inspired by the code written in 2010 by George F. Burkhard, Eric T. Hoke at Stanford University, which was ported to python in 2012 by Kamil Mielczarek (kamil.m@utdallas.edu) at the University of Texas at Dallas. See http://web.stanford.edu/group/mcgehee/transfermatrix/ for the source code. The code they have written is targeted towards simulating the absorption within solar cells and the reference 

> Accounting for Interference, Scattering, and Electrode Absorption to Make Accurate Internal Quantum Efficiency Measurements in Organic and Other Thin Solar Cells_, G. F. Burkhard, E. T. Hoke, M. D. McGehee, Adv. Mater., 22, 3293 

shows the type of simulations that can be performed.

Another good transfer matrix package, which parts of this code borrows from, is the "**tmm**" package by Steven Byrnes (http://sjbyrnes.com), which may be found at https://pypi.python.org/pypi/tmm.

#### LifetimeTmm
The derivation and implementation of the equations is given in 

> Quantum theory of spontaneous emission in multilayer dielectric structures, Creatore, Celestino and Andreani, Lucio Claudio.

### Author
This package was created by Thomas Mann (@mn14tm), a PhD researcher at the Faculty of Engineering in the University of Leeds. Please contact me for any questions!
